overview_summary: Among the neighboring landowners, four are family trusts of local farmers indicating long-held agricultural properties, and one is a major agribusiness. The family trusts (Lentz, Wirth, Whitmore, Olson) represent private individuals with substantial farmland but no corporate structure, so their development stance is personal and not publicly documented. The sole corporate neighbor is Jennie-O Turkey Store Inc., a Hormel Foods subsidiary operating a large turkey processing plant; it has significant economic influence but has shown no overt position on outside developments. No competitors or known organized opposition groups were identified in this neighbor set, though the farming families may be motivated to preserve land value and rural character, and the corporation will prioritize protecting its operations.

neighbors.name: Robert & Leondra Lentz Revocable Trust
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime local farming family; no notable public office or large economic influence

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Robert “Bob” Lentz (trustee) in a personal conversation emphasizing respect for their farm legacy and assuring the project will not harm their land interests

neighbors.name: Jennie-O Turkey Store Inc
neighbors.claims: Jennie-O Turkey Store Inc., a subsidiary of Hormel Foods, operates a major turkey processing plant in Barron, Wisconsin ([www.wctrib.com](https://www.wctrib.com/business/production-changes-planned-next-year-at-jennie-o-plant-in-wisconsin#:~:text=Jennie,from%20parent%20company%20Hormel%20Foods)). Local turkey farms supply this facility, contributing over $120 million annually to Barron County’s economy, while the plant itself adds more than $1 billion ([www.wpr.org](https://www.wpr.org/agriculture/barron-county-officials-take-economic-impact-bird-flu#:~:text=According%20to%20the%20University%20of,Dave%20Armstrong%20said%20the%20bird)). The company is one of the area’s largest employers and agribusiness stakeholders ([www.wpr.org](https://www.wpr.org/agriculture/barron-county-officials-take-economic-impact-bird-flu#:~:text=According%20to%20the%20University%20of,Dave%20Armstrong%20said%20the%20bird)). No record of public opposition to developments by Jennie-O was found, as its focus remains on maintaining stable operations and supply chains.
neighbors.influence_justification: Major agribusiness (Hormel subsidiary) with ~$1 billion local economic impact and extensive employment

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with Jennie-O’s corporate affairs or plant management to ensure the project poses no risk to their operations; emphasize potential mutual benefits (e.g., improved infrastructure or energy reliability) to secure neutrality or support

neighbors.name: Alicia M & Barry L Wirth Joint Revocable Trust
neighbors.influence_justification: Private landowners with no known broader influence in business or politics

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Alicia and Barry Wirth personally to discuss the project; address any concerns about land use changes and highlight any benefits or safeguards to ease potential opposition

neighbors.name: Blaine E & Vivian J Whitmore Revocable Trust
neighbors.influence_justification: Elderly farming couple; no public leadership roles or significant economic reach beyond their farm

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Blaine and Vivian Whitmore with a neighborly, transparent approach; reassure them the project will respect their property and minimize any disruption to their daily life or land use

neighbors.name: Alexander W & Mary J Olson Revocable Trust
neighbors.influence_justification: Large-scale farm operators with extensive landholdings; financially significant locally, though not public officials

approach_recommendations.engage: Meet directly with Alexander Olson (primary trustee) to understand his plans or concerns; emphasize how the project can coexist with or even benefit his farming operation, potentially through lease income or infrastructure improvements
